result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Strotter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine Strotter

records.addlTxt: 3:46 PM Defendant Jermaine Strotter appeared by video without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Right to be personally present at today's hearing explained to defendant.  Defendant confirms that he would like to proceed without being personally present in court.  Court finds that defendant agreeing to proceed by phone/video means, and waiving right to be personally present in court for today's proceedings. Attorney rights given.  Plea of  guilty entered.  Plea questionnaire gone through on the record with the Court.  Found guilty.  Court imposes $500 fine plus costs for a sum of $1,083.  Held cash bond to be applied to fine and costs.  DNA previously submitted.  Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Request to appear via zoom for 06/28/22 court date

10:34 AM Defendant Jermaine Strotter appeared by video without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant filed waiver of attorney form.  Waiver reviewed with the Court.  Court finds waiver knowing and voluntary.  Defendant enters not guilty pleas.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 28, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant appears by zoom without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to waive counsel at this time. Court adjourns initial appearance to May 16th at 10:00 am. bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jermaine Strotter appeared by video without counsel. Attorney Karl Peter Hayes for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Defendant has not received complaint. Defendant wishes to waive right to an Attorney. Waiver of right form and Criminal complaint will be mailed the the Defendant. Court adjourns initial appearance to April 11th at 11:00 am. bond continued.

Defendant appears by zoom without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets adjourned initial appearance to March 14th at 10:00 am to allow time for Defendant to receive criminal complaint. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets $500.00 cash bond. Court sets initial appearance for February 21st at 9:00 am.
